intro: Stelis juninensis, commonly known as the Junín stelis, is a member of the Orchidaceae family and is native to the Andean highlands of South America. It is an epiphytic orchid, typically found growing on trees or rocks in humid, shaded environments. The plant has slender, wiry stems and produces small, delicate flowers in shades of white and pale yellow. Its roots are specialized for absorbing moisture and nutrients from the air and rain. Stelis juninensis is valued for its ornamental appeal and is often cultivated by orchid enthusiasts.
